Deals like this are hard to pass up-several good movies at a great price. It had been a while since I'd watched any of the Bourne movies and thought for this price a pristine copy of each on Blu-Ray was a sound investment. I watched all the movies in one sitting which gave a sense of continuity to the stories and a new appreciation for Matt Damon's portrayal of the title character. You also have the making of the movie material included with the discs and most are worth a viewing if you're a fan. I was particularly interested how the car chases are filmed, one of the highlights of each movie. The fourth movie in this series isn't in this package, which for me was the main interest I picked this group. The fourth movie is a disappointment, adding nothing to the Bourne legacy. The video/audio transfer is excellent and for this price, I highly recommend you add this to your collection.

I'm a fan of action/espionage/drama/spy movies of all kinds. James Bond obviously being the most renowned, and after seeing the November Man with Pierce Brosnan and loving it, my friend twisted my arm into buying this collection to see the other juggernaut flagship series in the espionage/action movie world. I had never seen any of them (I know, slightly surprising, seeing as they constantly show them on television) and decided for the price, being a blu-ray, and being able to add the digital copies to my Vudu library, what the hell, I'd take the risk. So I watched through them, and personally felt that the first movie was alright, but seemed to me to be over hyped. I continued to watch the next two, and was slightly more impressed by them than the first (I'm sure I'll take flack for going against the grain here) but overall, I saw where people say that they are great movies, I was able to see why people say that they get sucked into them, and Matt Damon being the great actor as he is certainly played the "bad-a*s tough guy spy" role pretty well. Overall, though, even seeing all these things for what they were, I guess in the end this movie just wasn't for me. I saw the hype, the action, the twists and turns, but ultimately it was all just shy of being able to reach out and Jason Bourne choke slam me into it's conspiracy fueled dark and gritty James Bond-esque inter-continental thrill ride that others seemed to be so easily lost into. I haven't watched any of the movies since, maybe catching a scene or two on TV scrolling through channels when there's nothing else I can find to watch, but maybe a second run through of the series could revitalize my desire to be lost back in that world. Until that day, though, the physical copy remains perpetually lost amidst the disorganized piles that make up my ever growing blu-ray collection, and is nowhere to be found on the front page of my Vudu Library, so I don't think I'll hold my breath to give them the second chance they may (or may not) deserve.

The Bourne Identity was very mysterious; which i liked. The Bourne Supremacy was about regrets and The Bourne Ultimatum was about finding out the whole truth. All three of these movies touched my heart. To see an ex-assassin feel horrible about what he's done for what he is are good touches for The Bourne Troligy (Blu-Ray Version). Jason Bourne aka David Webb is a legend & I'm pretty sure the last one is going to be a bang. 5 stars for the main character, the storyline, the action, the creativeness & amazing drama.

Excellent. I forgot how good this trilogy was, since it's been a while since I've watched them. The price was good. It's awesome that you get s digital copy to watch online. What's the point of buying from ITunes. Buying physical media is better because you get the actual Disc and a digital copy. Usually for about the same price. The negative about buying media from ITunes is you have to watch it from Apples ecosystem. They only provide content in 1080p. And your at the mercy of your network connection. Would you buy a nice 4K TV and put media in the hands of Apple. Did you see them rushing a 4K Apple TV to market so people can watch media in 4K. Nope.  They will do it when they are ready and you can bet they will charge you more for 4K media. And I'm not hating on Apple. I have their products but I'm not a mindless consumer, I see through the BS. All of my Apple content resides on my personal media serve. Apple doesn't tell me when or how I get to watch the content I already bought.
